body: @Ishiihara I created https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/KAFKA-3315 to track this -- we should also adjust the title to match Kafka's PR title formatting rules.

LGTM.

The use in the test is a bit different because it'll happen on one of the VMs. This is still potentially a concern, but there's probably a lot less variability in the default setting for use of color in VMs than there is on the host machine for running the tests (where developers may have done a lot of things to customize their environment). I'd hold off on ensuring we handle this in all code that runs in the test VMs until we know somebody is encountering since I think it'll probably be unusual in that case.
And thanks for the patch @zhuchen1018!
Since this changes a public interface and it seems like there is no consensus on whether we should do it or not, doesn't that imply it needs a KIP?
@ewencp or @gwenshap, maybe one of you could take a look?
LGTM
cc @hachikuji
I can do a short KIP. The point @Parth-Brahmbhatt and I were discussing is should we have principal types specified via a config or via interface. We can discuss that over KIP.
Thanks for the patch. LGTM

@ijuma just added KIP-50, https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/KAFKA/KIP-50+-+Enhance+Authorizer+interface+to+be+aware+of+supported+Principal+Types.

@Parth-Brahmbhatt I have added your opinion on having a separate config option in the KIP. Based on how the KIP discussion goes, I will make changes accordingly. Do you mind reviewing the KIP.
:tada:

@SinghAsDev The KIP looks good to me. You can probably add that once this method is added we expect the Client of the authorizer to do the validation on principal types and the authorizer will still not do any validation by it self. As an alternative we can add the validation at Authorizer level.
@Parth-Brahmbhatt good point. Will add that shortly.
LGTM
Thanks for the patch. LGTM
@junrao Do wee need the BSD license for RocksDB dependency as well?
No, BSD is covered. See http://www.apache.org/legal/resolved.html#category-a
Got it, thanks.
LGTM

@ewencp I never was able to reproduce the failures, but when I ran the tests locally, I saw a bunch of easymock assertions which were getting mistakenly caught by the WorkerTask. I've fixed those in this patch, but I can't be sure that the transient failure won't pop up again.
Include the CDDL license directly as suggested by https://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/www-legal-discuss/201603.mbox/%3CCALGG8z1pm22YTQpoP0_n4xSomXHR6P-2gn4ie9VtLDLvhA2-ZA@mail.gmail.com%3E

This is great. Where's the tool you used to generate this? Can it do markdown?

Would love to work on converting the Kafka main-page docs to gitbook.com format https://www.gitbook.com
@christian-posta No tool was used. All the code used to generate this is in this pull request. Just some hacked together code to build the output.
added the missing log and reference to a JIRA. IMO the "info" log should stay, unless I'm underestimating how annoying it will be.
Thanks for raising this concern - group flapping is indeed undesirable.
I think the expectCall of sourceTask.commit should be inside expectedFlush (At least, I found it easier when tackling the exact same problem: https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/994)
Makes sense to me.

A reasonable question these test failures raise is whether we ought to be catching Exception instead of Throwable in the WorkerTask? The assertion failures are actually instances of Error, which are expected not to be caught by the application.
@miguno @ymatsuda for reviews.
LGTM
Merged to trunk.
@gwenshap Ready for another look. I added code to rethrow instances of Error from WorkerTask. Does that seem reasonable?
LGTM
Fixed in KAFKA-3290
LGTM
LGTM

Explanation on INFO level makes sense.

LGTM
@ZoneMayor I noticed a few more things that should be cleaned up, but this looks ready to commit after those minor tweaks. Thanks for sticking with this patch!

@guozhangwang @gwenshap Trivial fix for issue introduced in #999 / f676cfeb83195f032e3ad8908288a7e04011c830 due to checkstyle rules. (Although I am a bit confused since checkstyle docs seem to indicate javadocs are searched by default and I can't find overrides, the tests are failing both locally and on Apache jenkins. Fully qualifying is ugly, but safe resolution for the issue).
@ewencp Thanks for the catch! LGTM and merged to trunk.
LGTM
@ewencp  thanks a lot for your comment, ~I modified this again, please check

This is very easy patch.
Can anybody review this?
LGTM, cc @gwenshap
@miguno Thanks for the catch, but unfortunately the fix is not solving the problem, I will send out another PR for this.
@miguno @ewencp for reviews.
LGTM, but I'm not intimately familiar with the code here.
LGTM, thanks @ZoneMayor!
@hachikuji @guozhangwang I removed the 'topic' prefix and all tests have passed. Could you help merge this change?

Thanks for the patch. Now that we are changing the broker registration in ZK, could we update the upgrade doc to warn users that they need to upgrade from 0.9.0.1 (instead of 0.9.0.0) to 0.10.0? Otherwise, the old scala consumer in 0.9.0.0 will break once the broker is upgraded to 0.10.0.
LGTM
LGTM. Thanks for the contribution.
LGTM

This change will now make a call to zookeeper for every add/remove call. I am assuming that the volume of ACL modification requests to the authorizer would be quite low, therefore this is okay. If thats not the case, let me know. 

I think this issue can still occur with multiple Zookeeper nodes in the case where the client gets a stale zookeeper read. I am not sure the best way to handle this with Zookeeper and our packaged client. @fpj do you have any recommendations on making sure the "read, update, write" pattern is synchronized/safe? Do we need a completely different approach? (links or research material are welcome)
The changes look good. It will be nice to have this committed. @gaob13 do you mind rebasing?
Thanks for the patch. LGTM
@ijuma @granthenke I added some unit tests for MetadataCache and tried to address Ismael's comments.

Ping @gwenshap @ewencp 

I still haven't been able to reproduce the failure, but it seems possible for the mock validation to execute before the shutdown hook is called in WorkerTask. It's possible because we count down the shutdown latch prior to calling onShutdown(). So the fix is to call onShutdown() first, which actually seems more correct anyway.
LGTM
Not closing the JIRA, just in case....
LGTM. and sorry for dropping this :)
I'm afraid it makes our documentation more confusing. I think examples are clearer when they are more specific. If you have other principal types in mind, maybe add another example?
Thanks for the patch. LGTM
@ijuma, @becketqin could you guys review this.

@gwenshap yea, however there is no principal type that has to be there for an authorizer implementation. But, I see your point on specific examples can be helpful. I will change text bit more so that user is used only for example.
@gwenshap added the user examples back and added notes on principalType.
@knusbaum  can you close this pr for now.  see the discussion in the jira.
LGTM
Thanks for the help improvement :)
LGTM
@gwenshap mind taking a look.

so, functionally, it looks fine. However, it is also getting to be crazy ugly. 
Any chance you can give this another thought and come up with a way to encapsulate the logic for the different options so it won't get uglier and uglier? 

Perhaps @granthenke or @ijuma have suggestions.

@gwenshap totally agree that it is becoming hard to read. One reason I was a bit hesitant on making a lot of changes is that TopicCommand does not have tests, so breaking things is very easy. I just filed, KAFKA-3331, to add unit tests for TopicCommand. As part of that I will make it more readable as well. Either this can go in and I will address this as part of KAFKA-3331 or I can first work on KAFKA-3331. I am fine either ways.
@guozhangwang Do you have time to review the patch?
@junrao may be able to review this.

Started a system tests build:
https://jenkins.confluent.io/job/kafka_system_tests_branch_builder/382/

Thanks for the PR @allenxwang. I did an initial pass and left a few comments/questions and I submitted a PR with some fixes and improvements:

https://github.com/allenxwang/kafka/pull/1

Please review and integrate in any way you please (merge, cherry-pick, manually, etc.).

I will take a second and final pass by the end of Monday.
LGTM
@gwenshap @ijuma @granthenke mind taking a look at this.

@ijuma @SinghAsDev @fpj I updated the patch to be "safe". So that stale reads and race conditions are handled. It does this by tracking its expected zookeeper version and handling write failures. Its also more optimistic about its cached values instead of reading from zookeeper every time. I also added a test that concurrently updates the same node with 110 mixed requests. 

This definitely makes the SimpleAclAuthorizer more safe, but perhaps less "simple".

The only real change in this PR is to describeTopic, and the main issue is that the "if" logic is becoming hard to follow. Are you sure this cannot be improved at minimal risk without large changes to the class as a whole?
@gwenshap @ewencp Ping for review.
@ewencp @gwenshap Ping for review.
LGTM
Ah, sorry - looks like there are merge conflicts. @jjkoshy, mind rebasing?
LGTM

@gwenshap sure the if logic can be improved. However, it will still remain hard to test. I can simplify the if logic here in this patch, and we can take the testability issue to KAFKA-3331. Does that sound OK?

The boolean logic in this class is very weird. :) Lots of clauses and lots of negations. It should certainly be possible to make things better, but it needs a bit more time than I have to look at it right now.
@ijuma @gwenshap made some minor modifications to make it, hopefully, more readable. Let me know if I can improve it. Also, KAFKA-3331 should help out with simplifying and testing this.
Do you want to create a JIRA first? Are you planning to add some test that actually needs this refactoring?

Currently, I am using my own class with these modifications to be able to execute multi-threaded tests. In addition, I need to implement some business logic wihtin the rebalance listener which I need to test too. I will create a JIRA for these modifications.

The Jira is created : https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/KAFKA-3340
The commit messages has been updated
@gwenshap maybe you can review this? It's a simple change, but it improves what goes in the logs in some cases. Tests passed locally.
cc @junrao @guozhangwang
@fpj Do you have time to review this? Thank you.
@fpj I have answered your questions above. Are you ok with these changes?
@guozhangwang Do you have time to review this PR? Thank you.
Is there still some issue when non-default classes are configured?

@allenxwang, thanks for addressing the review comments and merging my PR. As promised, I completed my review today and I left one comment and created another PR with more code style improvements:

https://github.com/allenxwang/kafka/pull/2

I think we're pretty close (but we'll be sure once Jun takes another look). As far as I can see, outside of the PR I filed, the following is potentially outstanding:
- [ ] A couple of deprecated constructors in `UpdateMetadataRequest.java` are only used in tests. I'd like to @junrao to confirm that we actually need them.
- [x] I think we need to tweak the AdminUtils.assignReplicasToBrokers comment a little to integrate it better with what we had there previously.
- [ ] Jun asked if some tests are actually needed or if they can be simplified. @allenxwang explained why they are needed, so if Jun is happy with the explanation, then this is resolved.
- [x] Finally, the only non-minor change (although mechanical) is whether we should use a `BrokerMetadata` class instead of broker ids and a separate `rackInfo` map (suggested by Jun). Allen wasn't sure if this was better so it's still being discussed.

@ijuma @Parth-Brahmbhatt @SinghAsDev @fpj @ewencp @gwenshap 
Could any of you review this today?
